alert.note: Alert for Cook; De Kalb; DuPage; Ford; Grundy; Iroquois; Kane; Kankakee; Kendall; La Salle; Livingston; Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued February 21 at 12:16PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Heavy rainfall and localized flooding possible Wednesday afternoon and evening... Rainfall, heavy at times, is expected on Wednesday across most of northeast Illinois and northwest Indiana. Local areas may receive rainfall heavy enough to cause river rises, widespread ponding of water, and localized flooding. Soil moisture ranges from near average in east central Illinois to above average in northern Illinois. Most area soils have no remaining frost depth except for the headwaters of the Fox and Rock rivers in southern Wisconsin. All snow cover has melted due to recent mild temperatures. The lack of snow cover and frozen soils may somewhat reduce the risk of flooding, but this may be balanced out by the expected heavy rainfall rates, elevated soil moisture, and evapotranspiration. The current forecast of 1 to 2 inches of rainfall would likely cause several area rivers, including the Little Calumet, Kankakee, Iroquois, Fox, and Illinois, to near or exceed bankfull levels. The exact river basins that will see near flood stage conditions is heavily dependent on the location of heavy rainfall, which remains uncertain. This outlook means that elevated water levels and potential impacts are possible, but not yet certain. Persons should closely monitor forecasts including the possibility of flood watches, warnings, and advisories. An update to this outlook will be issued by tomorrow morning.
